qas.question: Which North American version of football calls for 12 player per side on the field?
How many yards wider is a Canadian football field than an American football field?
Which version of North American football has smaller end zones?
How many downs does a team have to advance ten yards in Canadian football?
How far away from the line of scrimmage must Canadian football defenders be?
In America what term is used for both Canadian foobal and Americam football
An American football field is how much wider than a Canadian football field?
Canadian and American football have the same number of what on the field?
American football players have three downs to do what?
The American football defenders must be one you are from what?
Which version of North American football has a smaller football?
What has shared players and is closely related with differences?
In American football how many downs are needed to gain 10 yards?

plausible_answers.text: at least 1 yard from the line of scrimmage.

qas.question: When a down begins, how far away must the American defending team be?

plausible_answers.text: a team has only three downs to gain 10 yards

qas.question: What causes the American game to have less offensive rushing?

context: In Canada, the term "<b5_0>football<b5_0/>" may refer to <a0_0>Canadian<a0_0/> football and <a2_0>American<a2_0/> football collectively, or to either sport specifically, depending on context. <b11_0>The two sports<b11_0/> have shared origins and are closely related but have significant differences. In particular, Canadian football has 12 <b7_0>players<b7_0/> on the field per team rather than 11; the field is roughly <a1_0>10<a1_0/> yards wider, and 10 yards longer between end-zones that are themselves 10 yards deeper; and <b14_0>a team has only <a3_0><b12_0>three<a3_0/> downs to <b8_0>gain <b6_0>10 yards<b14_0/><b12_0/><b8_0/><b6_0/>, which results in less offensive rushing than in the American game. In the Canadian game all players on the defending team, when a down begins, must be <b13_0>at least <a4_0>1 yard<a4_0/> from <b9_0>the line of scrimmage.<b13_0/><b9_0/> (The <b10_0>American<b10_0/> game has a similar "neutral zone" but it is only the length of the football.)
